column4: Has anyone here used Mathematica? I am looking for some FSF equivalent in Ubuntu, which can do *symbolic* computations (no, Octave can't)
i've used maple 9.5 in fc3
but i couldn't tell you how to install it to save my life
Yes, maple is pretty good too, but you can't apt-get that right? Isn't it proprietary?
maple is also what I use in school .. but I want to have some sort of a decent symbolic computation tool for Ubuntu
sorry i don't even know what apt-get is
maple is comparable (some say better) than mathematica
ok don't bother. maple is basically not free..
neither is mathematica
Yep, maple and mathematica are comparable, but they are not free..
maybe u thinking of maxima?
maxima? what is that?
that doesn't sound like anything I have heard before?
maxima and mupad are both symbolic, i'm pretty sure harisund.  you can google them i guess
one or both of them are free i think
ah ha ! Thanks .. will check up on them.... yes, it looks like maxima is free..
isn't it a bit odd to have a single op bot?  i mean what if ubotu crashes?
k
you know what, a couple of days back there was a netsplit.
and ubotu was indeed lost :D
no troll took controll and banned everyone?  maybe that's not possible... anyway, way off topic
join me in ubuntu-offtopic
